Setting Archive Creation Options

To perform this procedure, you must first select the project database or project you want to configure. The project database or project must also be associated with a configuration file.

To set archive creation options:

  1. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  2. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  3. Select Creation Attributes beneath Archives. The Creation Attributes pane on the right appears. The values that display for each option are the settings that are currently defined in the configuration file associated with the project database or project.

  4. To set the options, do any of the following:

    • Select either One or More Than One for the locks allowed on each archive.
    • Enter the user ID of the owner of new archives. The value <Current User> is the user who is running Version Manager at the time of archive creation.
    • Enter the access list groups and individual users (user IDs) who can access newly created archives in the Access List field. The combined value of this field cannot exceed 254 characters in length. The groups and user IDs that you specify must be defined in the access control database. Values must be separated by commas.
    • Select the Write protect archive check box to write-protect the archives. Setting this option protects archives from inadvertent deletion or modification.
    • Select the OK to create new archive on check in check box to automatically create an archive when you check in a workfile if Version Manager cannot find one for the file. Otherwise, a message is issued and no archive is created. This option applies only to the command-line interface.
    • Select the Split On Create check box to automatically split new archives into separate metadata and revision components if they are mapped to a revision path by the Version Manager File Server. This directive is for use with the Revision Library feature of the Version Manager File Server.

  5. Click OK if you are finished defining options, or click Apply to save the settings and continue to define other options.
